{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the most recent standards set by the ACGME, residents are allowed to work a maximum of 80 hours per week, averaged over a 4-week period. The resident in question is currently working 60 hours per week as a resident and an additional 10-hour shift outside of his residency program on Saturdays. This totals to 70 hours per week, which is within the allowed limit. Therefore, the resident may work up to 20 more hours outside of his residency obligations.", "answer_choice": "D"}
